meanings.sent1: The waterfall was effusive, flowing endlessly down the rocks.
meanings.sent2: The volcano erupted with effusive lava, covering everything in its path.
meanings.sent3: The effusive fountain in the park delighted children as they played around it.
meanings.sent4: Her effusive generosity knew no bounds, always giving more than anyone expected.
meanings.sent5: The effusive rain poured down, creating puddles everywhere.

meanings.sent1: She received an effusive welcome from her fans at the concert.
meanings.sent2: The audience gave an effusive applause after the moving performance.
meanings.sent3: His effusive joy at winning the game was contagious, spreading to everyone around him.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky with effusive colors, filling the horizon with beauty.
meanings.sent5: Her effusive laughter echoed through the room, brightening up the atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Characterized by unrestrained or excessive display of affection or emotion
meanings.sent1: Their effusive hugs and kisses showed how much they missed each other.
meanings.sent2: The puppy greeted its owner with effusive tail wagging and joyful barks.
meanings.sent3: The effusive display of fireworks lit up the night sky in celebration.
meanings.sent4: Her effusive compliments made everyone feel appreciated and valued.
meanings.sent5: The effusive cheers from the crowd filled the stadium with excitement.
